messages.title: Chuka: a fresh start
messages.content: It's not good enough just to appear on your doorstep at election times. Our area has huge potential, yet we still see problems and the gap between the rich and poor is still too wide.

messages.title: Chuka: doing politics differently
messages.content: People are fed up with our 'punch and judy' style of politics where people shout and abuse each other for the sake of it.

messages.title: Spotlight
messages.content: Leaning leftward, against the Iraq war, for proportional representation and a high pay commission. If the Labour Party has an optimistic face, it's his.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Against the 'punch and judy' style of politics, advocates for a more civil and productive political debate.

issues.education: Chuka started his schooling at Christ Church Primary School in Brixton, Simon Gatterty of above was a contemporary (Chuka's life's ambition from a young age to become MP of this area).
issues.governance: Against the 'punch and judy' style of politics, advocates for a more civil and productive political debate.

housing.content: It's not good enough just to appear on your doorstep at election times. Our area has huge potential, yet we still see problems and the gap between the rich and poor is still too wide.

leaflet.personalStatement: It would be a huge privilege to serve you and put something back into the place I'm from.

politicalExperience.role: Next on the board of governors at Stixton - a not-for-profit youth project

endorsements.endorsement: I am sure Chuka is the best possible candidate for our locality and I am delighted to have him as my successor.
Leaning leftward, against the Iraq war, for proportional representation and a high pay commission. If the Labour Party has an optimistic face, it's his.

quotes.text: Chuka is a 21st century candidate who was born and brought up in Streatham. I am sure Chuka will be the best possible candidate for our locality.

Chuka has been active in the community for years. He has served as a governor of Sunnyhill Primary School for three years and sits on the board of governors at Stixton - a not-for-profit youth project.

images.caption: Chuka Umunna at the World Estate Community Day, 2009.
